sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Handwritten letter from Schenker to Moriz Violin, undated [c. February 1, 1900]
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: Schenker is about to write to Busoni. -- He is just off to the Leiners' house to substitute for Violin [while the latter is in Berlin]. -- Eduard [Violin] is asking for a handout.

tei:div.tei:p: Dank für Karte! was schon besorgt.The postcard from Violin is not known to survive.
Nun, wie steht’s? An Busoni schreib’ ich erst heute: das hat seine Gründe.

Bis du auf deinem eigenen Ort bist,Violin is apparently in Berlin. schreibe ich dir mehr. In einer Stunde geh’ ich zum ersten-
mal zu Leiners’, deine Verlassenschaft zu pflegen.“Verlassenschaft” strictly means “estate” or “inheritance,” but this is one of four letters in this folder (1897–1900) in which is discussed Schenker’s giving Violin’s piano lessons during his absence in Berlin, and the fees to be charged. The others, all in 1900, are: OJ 6/3, [13] (February 8), OJ 6/3, [19] (November 2), and OJ 6/3, [20] (December 11). On internal evidence, the present letter is the first in sequence, thus belongs before February 8.

Tag nach deiner Abreise hat mich Eduard consultirt;This is one of four letters that refer to Eduard Violin in this folder (1897–1900), the others being OJ 6/3, [2] (April 2, 1897), OJ 6/3, [15] (April 27, 1900), and OJ 6/3, [19] (November 2, 1900). er braucht nicht weniger als 1500 Gulden.
Der Bruder Mozio hat ihm einen Rath gegeben, den er auch befolgt. Er wollte es aber umsonst – warum?! – von Popper oder irgend einem anderen „Mäcen“. Er!!
Thank you for your postcard, which I’ve already taken care of.
Now, how do things stand? Only today am I writing to Busoni – there are reasons for that.

When you are in your own place, I will write you more. In an hour I will be going for the first time
to the Leiners to hold the fort during your absence.

The day after your departure, Eduard approached me; he needs nothing less than 1,500 Florins.
My brother Mozio has given him a piece of advice that he has gone and acted on. But he wanted it for free – why?! – from Popper or any other “patron.” He!!
